intro: Eriocaulon seemannii, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, often in tropical and subtropical regions. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, wind-pollinated flowers. Eriocaulon seemannii is often found in dense vegetation, contributing to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
